content.description:
A fun, big, interesting line in a remote, hard to access valley. When snow height is down and access easier, it becomes a destination line in the valley.  The route offers a wide variety of terrain with good pro and is a good objective for a remote multi-pitch ice experience.The ice is thin in places, swing gently and screw slowly to avoid damaging points.  Rock gear might be handy near the top of P1. 
  
 P1; Climb thin ice to a steep rock slot, then up the snow ledge to a fixed anchor (pins) on the right. Rock gear might be helpful if the ice is thin.  190' 
 P2; Move left and climb thin ice that improves as you go, setting up a sheltered belay in an alcove.  130' 
 P3; Climb as steep shield of ice off the belay, and continue up and left to a comfortable belay in a another alcove.  110' 
 P4; Climb steep, continuous ice to v-threads just below the top. 170'

This route is located deep in Protection Valley, on the right side, behind Castle Mountain. Scramble up a steep slope (avalanche prone) and a comfortable belay station at the base of the route.
Screws, rock gear, occasional v-threads along the way.

Located between Protection Mountain and the west end of Castle Mountain, this amazing and hard to reach valley is home to many high quality multi-pitch ice and mixed routes.  And no matter the grade, they are remote and serious undertakings. Furthermore, DO NOT consider climbing in this valley unless avi hazard is low.  When avi hazard is low, this place becomes popular, so if you are lucky there will be a trail to follow on the way in.
